edu.umass.cs.gnsserver.activecode.prototype

Class ActiveNonBlockingClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umass.cs.gnsserver.activecode.prototype.ActiveNonBlockingClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Client, Runnable

    public class ActiveNonBlockingClient
extends Object
implements Runnable, Client
    This is a Client implementation with unix named pipe as the way to communicate with workers. This client send requests to its worker and register a local monitor to block the sending thread. Until the receiving thread receives the response or a query, it wakes up the sending thread. This design relies on the fact that if the writer end of a named pipe is closed, the reader end will also be closed, and return a null value. Therefore, if the worker is crashed, this client will know immediately.
    Author:
    gaozy

      • runCode

        public ValuesMap runCode(InternalRequestHeader header,
                         String guid,
                         String field,
                         String code,
                         ValuesMap valuesMap,
                         int ttl,
                         long budget)
                  throws ActiveException
        This runCode method sends the request to worker, and wait for worker to finish the request. If the worker crashed during the request execution, this method will resend the request to a new created worker, and the new worker will execute this request again.

        If the worker fails to execute the request, it will send back an error to inform this method that the execution gets accomplished with an error. This method will raise an ActiveException, and the method which calls this method needs to handle this exception.

        Specified by:
        runCode in interface Client
        Parameters:
        guid -
        field -
        code -
        valuesMap -
        ttl -
        Returns:
        executed result sent back from worker
        Throws:
        ActiveException
